channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.description:
Report E-2023090225

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

item.title: Report X-2023080788
item.description:
Report X-2023080788

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the box arrived at the hazmat cage with wet conditions. Upon inspection, the package with1 of 4 bottles containing "Advantage chemicals oven & grill cleaner" was discovered to have a loose cap. Package was placed into a salvage drum to be returned to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap on 1 out of 4 of the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately tightened and placed into a salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023081083
item.description:
Report X-2023081083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When Joe Cook (Ops manager) went through his door checks, he discovered a leaking package that turned out to be a hazmat. The spillage was limited to the outer packages. The QA put on proper PPE and contained hazmat in a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: The package did not have visible cracks or punctures in the inner containers. The caps of both of the containers were a bit loose upon evaluation DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was stored within a red hazardous materials bin and kept upright upon inspection.
